item.title: Nicole add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "One need not be a chamber to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "In the lives of children, pumpkins turn into coaches, mice and rats turn into men. When we grow up, we realize it is far more common for men to turn into rats." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I dwell in possibility…" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Pardon My Sanity In A World Insane" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Dominique Paul
item.description: "Just then, a singly firefly flashes its light, then another. Within a minute the darkness is filled with fireflies, twinkling their silent melody. I think about all the people in the world, how each of us has a place where we belong. I wonder then what my place looks like. Because I am not there, and I am not sure I have ever seen it." -- Dominique Paul

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "When we were children, we used to think that when we were grown-up we would no longer be vulnerable. But to grow up is to accept vulnerability... To be alive is to be vulnerable." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Some things have to be believed to be seen." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Like and equal are not the same thing at all." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeline L'Engle
item.description: "Hate hurts the hater more'n the hated." -- Madeline L'Engle

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Creative scientists and saints expect revelation and do not fear it. Neither do children. But as we grow up and we are hurt, we learned not to trust." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeline L'Engle
item.description: "Because to take away a man's freedom of choice, even his freedom to make the wrong choice, is to manipulate him as though he were a puppet and not a person." -- Madeline L'Engle

item.title: Nicole add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description:
"When you look at what C.S. Lewis is saying, his message is so anti-life, so cruel, so unjust. The view that the Narnia books have for the material world is one of almost undisguised contempt. At one point, the old professor says, ‘It’s all in Plato’ — meaning that the physical world we see around us is the crude, shabby, imperfect, second-rate copy of something much better. I want to emphasize the simple physical truth of things, the absolute primacy of the material life, rather than the spiritual or the afterlife.
[<i>The New York Times interview, 2000</i>]" -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence. <I>Thou shalt not</I> is soon forgotten, but <I>Once upon a time</I> lasts forever." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Thinking I'm a moron gives people something to feel smug about," Charles Wallace said. "Why should I disillusion them?" -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "When I have something to say that I think will be too difficult for adults, I write it in a book for children. Children are excited by new ideas; they have not yet closed the doors and windows of their imaginations. Provided the story is good... nothing is too difficult for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle
